paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two truncating variants, namely BRCA1(NM_007297.4):c.1374del (p.Asp458Glusfs*17) and BRCA2(NM_000059.4):c.7934del (p.Arg2645Asnfs*3) were observed for Case 2.
BRCA1(NM_007297.4):c.45dup (p.Asn16Ter) and BRCA2 c.7934del detected for Case 3.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 c.7934del variant is a truncating mutation that leads to loss of function, impacting DNA repair mechanisms.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is likely to segregate with disease in affected family members.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on clinical significance and family history.
variants.additional_notes: The BRCA2 c.7934del variant is noted as a confirmed South African founder variant.
key_quotes: The presence of specific variants can impact and change a patient’s treatment plan.
These two cases currently represent the third and fourth occurrence of DH involving founder variants in BRCA1/2 in SA.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The splice-site variant (BRCA2 (NM_000059.4):c.516G>A, p.Lys172=) will result in the absence of all BRC repeats responsible for the binding of RAD51.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 c.516G>A variant is a splice-site variant that may disrupt normal splicing and protein function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is likely to segregate with disease in affected family members.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on clinical significance and family history.
variants.additional_notes: The clinical significance of this variant is supported by its role in disrupting the binding of RAD51.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were successfully extracted.
